title: Connecting Rod - Installation

body.body: Connecting rod bolts must only be used once.
If you loosen or remove the bolts for any reason, always install new bolts.
If you use the bolts again, the connecting rods and their caps could detach from the crankshaft causing severe engine damage.
This could leading to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Clean the connecting rod with high flash-point solvent.
Remove all bearings and inspect for damage, wear and any signs of deterioration and replace as necessary.
Make sure the piston is correctly fitted to the connecting rod.
When you assemble a previously run engine, always make sure that the piston and connecting rod are assembled in the same orientation as before disassembly.
Select the big end bearing shells (see
Connecting Rod Big End Journal Checking, Measuring and Bearing Selection
Fit the bearing shells to the connecting rod and the big end cap, lubricate with a 50/50 solution of engine oil and molybdenum disulphide grease.
Align the connecting rod to the crankshaft and fit the big end cap.
It is very important that the correct lubrication is applied to correctly torque the connecting rod bolts.
If the threads and under head areas are not lubricated with molybdenum disulphide grease, the bolts may be stretched and may become loose when in service.
This can result in an engine failure.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Lubricate the threads and under-head area of the new bolts with molybdenum disulphide grease.
Evenly and progressively tighten the bolts as follows:
You must follow the correct procedure below to tighten the bolts.
If all the torque is applied in one action, the bolt may be stretched and may become loose when in service resulting in an engine failure.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
